subject: Re: [junit] re: Publicly accessible JUnit 3.8.x Javadoc
msgSnippet: Hi An unknown  mirror is not a good solution for me. I could place JUnit javadocs somewhere on my server, but I would prefer the original ones. I thought about
messageBody:
Hi

An unknown mirror is not a good solution for me. I could place JUnit
javadocs somewhere on
my server, but I would prefer the original ones.

I thought about it.
Maybe JUnit could have three versions of javadocs:
- 3.8.x only - http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc_38/
- 4.0.x only - http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc_40/
- both merged - http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/

What do you think about it?

Grzegorz Slowikowski

Jeanne Boyarsky wrote:
>
>
> > I wanted to link my tests javadocs with JUnit 3.8.x javadocs
> > using "link" parameter. I cannot find it. I found only javadocs >
> for 4.0.x line. Is is published somewhere?
> I'm sure it's in the download of JUnit 3.8 on sourceforge. (although I
> didn't look there.)
>
> I did search online and found a mirror. Looks accurate to me:
> http://api.dpml.net/junit/3.8.1/index.html
> <http://api.dpml.net/junit/3.8.1/index.html>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
